prompt: <description>**CAD Model Generation Instructions** The final CAD model is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. It is constructed from eight individual parts, each with specific sketches, curves, loops, and faces. The following sections provide detailed instructions for constructing each part. **Part 1** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.075, 0.675, 0.075] Create a sketch on face 1 of this coordinate system. The sketch should have a single face (face_1) containing a single loop (loop_1). Loop_1 consists of four lines (line_1, line_2, line_3, line_4) that form a rectangle: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.6, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.6, 0.0], End Point [0.6, 0.6] - line_3: Start Point [0.6, 0.6], End Point [0.0, 0.6] - line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.6], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch into a 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.6 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.6 **Part 2** Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height of the prism is half the length of the sides. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.075, 0.525, 0.1634] Create a sketch on face 1 of this coordinate system. The sketch should have a single face (face_1) containing a single loop (loop_1). Loop_1 consists of four lines (line_1, line_2, line_3, line_4) that form a rectangle: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.075, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.075, 0.0], End Point [0.075, 0.075] - line_3: Start Point [0.075, 0.075], End Point [0.0, 0.075] - line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.075], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch into a 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.075 - Sketch scale: 0.3 **Part 3** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the sides are equal. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] - Translation Vector: [0.2304, 0.5399, 0.075] Create a sketch on face 1 of this coordinate system. The sketch should have a single face (face_1) containing a single loop (loop_1). Loop_1 consists of four lines (line_1, line_2,</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a rectangular prism shape with a triangular top. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.3132, 0.0]. Next, create a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. * Draw line_1 from the point (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) * Draw line_2 from the point (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.2885) * Draw line_3 from the point (0.75, 0.2885) to (0.0, 0.2885) * Draw line_4 from the point (0.0, 0.2885) to (0.0, 0.0) Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, using the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" operation, with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.3132 and an extrusion depth opposite the normal of 0. The height, width and length of this intermediate part are 0.75, 0.3132 and 0.75 respectively. Part 2 Construct a block shape with a rectangular base and a smaller rectangular section cut out of the top in a staggered manner. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to [180.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.7005, 0.3132, 0.1236]. Next, create a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. * Draw line_1 from the point (0.0, 0.0) to (0.6511, 0.0) * Draw line_2 from the point (0.6511, 0.0) to (0.6511, 0.1648) * Draw line_3 from the point (0.6511, 0.1648) to (0.0, 0.1648) * Draw line_4 from the point (0.0, 0.1648) to (0.0, 0.0) Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, using the "CutFeatureOperation" operation, with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.0 and an extrusion depth opposite the normal of 0.2473. The height, width and length of this intermediate part are 0.6511, 0.2473 and 0.6511 respectively. The final CAD shape is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. This is formed by part_1 and part_2. The height of the final CAD shape is calculated by summing the height of the intermediate parts, and is thus 1.4044 for this assembly.</description>

prompt: <description>**Construct the curved metallic object with a hollow center** **Part 1** **Overview** The first part is a 3D model of a curved, metallic object with a hollow center, resembling a pipe or tube with a flared opening at one end. It is constructed using a single sketch and a single extrusion. **Sketch** 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0202, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Create a new sketch on the XY plane. 3. Draw the curve for face 1 as follows: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0288, 0.3483], End Point [0.0487, 0.2883] - Arc 1: Start Point [0.0487, 0.2883], Mid Point [0.1081, 0.0737], End Point [0.3259, 0.12] - Line 2: Start Point [0.3259, 0.12], End Point [0.3838, 0.12] - Arc 2: Start Point [0.3838, 0.12], Mid Point [0.6015, 0.0737], End Point [0.6609, 0.2883] - Line 3: Start Point [0.6609, 0.2883], End Point [0.6809, 0.3483] - Arc 3: Start Point [0.6809, 0.3483], Mid Point [0.7096, 0.1222], End Point [0.5172, 0.0] - Line 4: Start Point [0.5172, 0.0], End Point [0.1924, 0.0] - Arc 4: Start Point [0.1924, 0.0], Mid Point [0.0, 0.1222], End Point [0.0288, 0.3483] **Extrusion** 1. Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.1701 units and along the opposite direction by 0.0 units. 2. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.7096. 3. The resulting 3D model is the first part. **Dimensions:** - length: 0.7096 - width: 0.7096 - height: 0.1701 Note: The final shape is constructed by creating and combining multiple parts using boolean operations. The shape and size of the final part will match the final shape described in the CAD Assembly JSON.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. Set the Euler angles to (0, 0, -90) degrees and the translation vector to (0, 0.5, 0). The Z-axis of this coordinate system will represent the normal direction for the sketch and extrusion. Create the Sketch for Part 1 Using the newly created coordinate system, draw the 2D sketch on face 1 of the sketch plane. Create loop 1 of the sketch as follows: 1. line_1: Start Point (0, 0); End Point (0.75, 0) 2. line_2: Start Point (0.75, 0); End Point (0.75, 0.75) 3. line_3: Start Point (0.75, 0.75); End Point (0.5, 0.75) 4. line_4: Start Point (0.5, 0.75); End Point (0.5, 0.25) 5. line_5: Start Point (0.5, 0.25); End Point (0.25, 0.25) 6. line_6: Start Point (0.25, 0.25); End Point (0.25, 0.75) 7. line_7: Start Point (0.25, 0.75); End Point (0, 0.75) 8. line_8: Start Point (0, 0.75); End Point (0, 0) This loop describes the perimeter of a rectangle with dimensions length 0.75 and width 0.5. Apply the following constraints to the loop: 1. Ensure the loop is closed. 2. The loop must only consist of lines (no arcs or circles). Scale the Sketch Scale the sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75, which will adjust the overall size of the rectangle. Transform 2D Sketch into 3D Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the rotation and translation defined by the coordinate system. Extrude the Sketch Extrude the 3D sketch in the normal direction of the sketch plane with a depth value of 0.5 units and no opposite-direction extrusion. The resulting 3D solid will have a slightly tapered shape with the top being wider than the bottom and parallel sides. Finish part 1 with the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" operation, which results in the creation of a new solid body.</description>

</json>
